lead_paragraph: Graphic images showed the vehicle tearing through the crowd. The driver was shot to death by the police, and France’s president called the assault “a monstrosity.”

byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin and Adam Nossiter reported from Paris, and Christopher Mele from New York. Reporting was contributed by Andrew Higgins from Nice, France; Aurelien Breeden, Lilia Blaise and Liz Alderman from Paris; Sewell Chan and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from London; and Rukmini Callimachi and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN, ADAM NOSSITER and CHRISTOPHER MELE

headline.print_headline: Truck Attack on French Crowd; Scores Die
headline.main: Scores Die in Nice, France, as Truck Plows Into Bastille Day Crowd

snippet: Graphic images showed the vehicle tearing through the crowd. The driver was shot to death by the police, and France’s president called the assault “a monstrosity.”...
abstract: Large truck plows through crowd of spectators observing Bastille Day fireworks celebration in Nice, France, killing at least 84 people and maiming many others, in what French officials are describing as terrorist attack; Prime Min Manuel Valls says country will observe three days of mourning, and officials urge residents to stay in their homes.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
